applicability_reasoning: This regulation specifically addresses requirements for providing information about product bundling during telephone communications with consumers. The document in question is a comprehensive pension scheme rules document that appears to be designed for written/printed delivery rather than telephone communications. The document is a formal policy document containing detailed scheme rules, definitions, and procedures that would be provided to trustees and members in written form. There is no indication in the document of any telephone-based sales or communication processes. The contact section (Section 6) does mention phone contact but only for general customer service purposes, not for product sales or bundling discussions. Additionally, this appears to be a standalone pension life cover product rather than a bundled product, so regulations specific to bundling would not apply.
regulation_title: Steps regarding information on bundling where communicating by telephone only
regulation_text: 95. For the purposes of the requirement to provide information pursuant to Regulation 92 to 94, if the regulated entity is communicating with the consumer by way of telephone only, the regulated entity shall - (a) provide the required information orally at the time of offering, recommending, arranging or providing the product, and (b) provide the required information to the consumer on paper or on another durable medium immediately after arranging or providing the product. Chapter 11 Errors resolution
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
